discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
-- To prepare the physical standby database to transition to a logical standby database:
-- - a. Issue the ALTER DATABASE RECOVER TO LOGICAL STANDBY db_name command to continue
-- - applying redo data to the physical standby database until it is ready to convert to a logical
-- - standby database. Specify a database name (db_name) to identify the new logical standby database.
-- The redo log files contain the information needed to convert your physical standby database to a
-- logical standby database. The statement applies redo data until the LogMiner dictionary is found
-- in the redo log files.

Selected Answer: B
B is correct

choices.E: It will automatically start redo apply.
choices.B: The Managed Recovery Process (MRPO) continues applying redo up to the SCN immediately preceding the redo corresponding to the LogMiner dictionary build.
choices.C: Supplemental logging will be enabled on the logical standby database when the physical database is transitioned to the logical standby database.
choices.D: SQL apply is automatically started when transitioning to the logical standby database.
choices.A: FLASHBACK is automatically enabled when transitioning to the logical standby database.

questions.question_text: Which two are true concerning the configuring of Flashback database in a Data Guard environment? (Choose two.)

choices.B: It is a prerequisite for the use of Fast Start Failover.
choices.E: It is required in order for a snapshot standby database to be converted to a physical database.
choices.D: It permits a physical standby database to be converted to a snapshot standby database.
choices.C: It permits a primary database that was disabled after failover to be reinstated as a standby.
choices.A: It enables the use of far sync instances.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
Flashback DB can be enable with the alter database to snapshot automatically.
Flashback is necessary to change standby DB to snapshot DB.
Snapshot to Standby is second phase

Selected Answer: BC
Choosing B and C because D is automatically enabled 

A. False - Far Sync instances do not required flashback - they don't have files to flash back
B. True - Flashback Database must be enabled on the primary database and target standby database(s).
C. True - reinstatement is enabled by flashback database. Otherwise, the new standby must be recreated from backup after failover
D. True - Flashback is automatically enabled when a physical standby is converted to a snapshot
F. False - A snapshot standby cannot be directly converted to a physical database directly. However, flashback is used to convert a snapshot standby to a physical standby, then that can be switched over or failed over.
I thiink C,E is the answer

Selected Answer: AB
Answer A and B

Selected Answer: AB
A and B

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true about Far Sync instances? (Choose two.)

choices.D: They do not work with Logical Standby databases.
choices.A: They work in Maximum Availability mode.
choices.E: They do not work with Snapshot Standby databases.
choices.C: They work in Maximum Protection mode.
choices.B: They work in Maximum Performance mode.

questions.question_text:
Your Data Guard environment has a remote physical standby database with real-time query enabled, which is used for reporting, and a logical standby database used for DSS reporting.

Switchovers or failovers are possible due to testing or in case of a disaster.

Clients use local TNSNAMES.ORA files to define connection strings to the database instances.

Which three will prevent clients from connecting to the wrong database instances? (Choose three.)

choices.G: The client applications must use the correct TNS entries when requesting connections to the database instances.
choices.C: Oracle Net connectivity to the primary database instance must be established on all the standby database instances.
choices.A: Client TNS entries for the databases use the correct service names for the intended service.
choices.F: The DB_NAME and DB_UNIQUE_NAME parameters must be set to the same value for all the databases in the Data Guard environment.
choices.E: The standby database services must be defined statically with the Listeners running on the standby database hosts.
choices.B: A service name is registered with the local listener of each database instance.
choices.D: The LOCAL_LISTENER parameter on the primary database instance must always be set.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABG
A,B,G

A - True - TNS names must use correct references
B - True - service names are required
C - False as it relates to the question - does not impact client connectivity
D - False as it relates to the question
E - Not relevant to client connectivity
F - False - not a valid configuration
G - True - TNS names must use correct references

Selected Answer: ABD
A,B and D

Selected Answer: ABD
A, B and D

choices.C: The PRODSBY1 standby database is automatically added to the configuration if DG_BROKER_START IS TRUE for PRODSBY1.
choices.A: The command will execute successfully only if Oracle Net connectivity to the PROD database instance is defined on the primary host.
choices.E: The PRODSBY1 standby database is automatically added to the configuration if Oracle Net connectivity to the PRODSBY1 database instance is defined on the primary host.
choices.D: The Data Guard Broker configuration files is automatically created in the destinations specified by the DG_BROKER_CONFIG_FILEn initialization parameters on the primary database.
choices.B: The command will execute successfully only if the DG_BROKER_START initialization is set to TRUE for the PROD database instance.
choices.F: The command will execute successfully only if Oracle Net connectivity to the PROD and PRODSBY1 database instances are defined on the primary host.

questions.question_text:
You created the PRODSBY1 physical standby database for the PROD primary database using SQL and RMAN.

You are planning to create a Data Guard Broker configuration.

You execute the command:

DGMGRL> CREATE CONFIGURATION ‘DGConfig’ AS
> PRIMARY DATABASE IS ‘PROD’
> CONNECT IDENTIFIER IS PROD;

Which three statements are true regarding the execution of the command? (Choose three.)
